intro: Hieracium mesomorphum, commonly known as the middle-form hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from June to September. Hieracium mesomorphum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
